properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-03T03:42:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-02T11:42:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3185919851.2021
Area: Highway 3 - Paulson Summit to Kootenay Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A frontal system will move across the BC Interior today through early Sunday giving significant snowfall to Kootenay Pass. Further snowfall accumulations of up to 45 cm are possible through Sunday morning for Kootenay Pass and Blueberry-Paulson Summit. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-03T03:42:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-02T11:42:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1206234443.2021
Area: Highway 3 - Paulson Summit to Kootenay Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of freezing rain continues early this morning. Freezing rain will transition back to snow in the next few hours with additional snowfall amounts of 2 to 4 cm possible. This prolonged period of freezing rain is expected to bring up to 5 mm of ice accretion to many areas. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break. Utility outages may occur. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-02T15:59:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-02T08:03:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3164613418.2021

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this morning. Moderate to heavy snow is expected early this morning as a low pressure system moves off to the east. A rapid snowfall accumulation of near 5 cm is possible early this morning. This snowfall may result in difficult winter driving conditions as roads can become snow covered and icy. Conditions are expected to improve later this morning as snow is expected to end early this morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-02T18:59:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-02T10:52:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2812625277.2021

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with gusty winds and visibility frequently near zero in blowing snow are expected or occurring. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Road closures are possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-03T03:21:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-02T11:21:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0672278010.2021
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with gusty winds and visibility frequently near zero in blowing snow are expected or occurring. An upper disturbance over northern Yukon will create strong east winds of 70 km/h near the Richardson Mountains today through Sunday morning. Poor visibility in blowing snow and extreme wind chill values near minus 45 are expected. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Road closures are possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-03T03:21:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-02T11:21:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0535141569.2021
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall accumulations of 10 to 15 cm expected. Time span: today and tonight. Remarks: Snow will start this morning over western areas of the province and reach Cape Breton by this afternoon. The snow will change to rain near noon in the west and then change back to a period of snow this evening before ending. Over western Cape Breton the snow will taper off to a few flurries overnight. Total snowfall accumulation of 10 to 15 cm is expected. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-03T00:49:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-02T08:49:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2519711248.2021
Area: Digby County, Inverness County - Mabou and north
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Very strong winds will develop late this morning, with wind gusts up to 110 km/h possible. The strongest winds are expected to be mid-afternoon. The winds will weaken by Sunday morning. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. Locations: Southern New Brunswick Time span: this morning until this evening. Remarks: Generally 15 to 25 cm of snow is expected with the possibility of locally higher amounts. Additionally, strong east to northeast winds gusting to 60 km/h may at times reduce visibility in blowing snow. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The approach of another moist Pacific frontal system will bring more heavy rain to the region today. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 50 mm are expected. The heavy rain will end by this evening as the frontal system moves across Vancouver Island. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: 10 to 15 cm of snow by Sunday morning. Snow will spread across northern Manitoba on Saturday, beginning midday near the Saskatchewan border and reaching the Ontario border by evening. The snow will taper off from west to east Saturday night. The highest snowfall accumulations are from Lynn Lake eastwards through Gillam and onwards. Up to 15 cm of snow is possible. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:

properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Total snowfall: 7 to 14 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northeasterly 70 km/h (possibly higher along parts of the coast). Locations; Burin Peninsula and southern Avalon Peninsula. Time span: Visibilities deteriorating overnight, then improving Sunday morning on the Burin Peninsula and near noon Sunday elsewhere. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this morning. Moderate to heavy snow is expected early this morning as a low pressure system moves off to the east. A rapid snowfall accumulation of near 5 cm is possible early this morning. This snowfall may result in difficult winter driving conditions as roads can become snow covered and icy. Conditions are expected to improve late this morning as snow is expected to end near mid morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-02T18:59:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-02T08:30:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0310142340.2021

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Another moist Pacific frontal system will bring more rain to the south coast today. The rain will become heavy late this afternoon and evening as the system moves across the valley. Total rainfall amounts of up to 60 mm are expected near Hope. The heavy rain will taper to a few showers near midnight in the wake of the front. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-03T04:39:31-00:00

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 25 to 30 cm is expected. Locations: Nova Scotia Time span: This morning until overnight tonight. Remarks: Snow will develop this morning in the west and spread to the rest of the province by this afternoon. Generally 15 to 25 cm of snow is expected however 30 cm or more is possible over northern and eastern areas of the province. Furthermore, strong east to northeast winds gusting to 60 to 80 km/h may significantly reduce visibility in blowing snow. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Road closures are possible. Heavy snowfall accumulation may cause tree branches to break. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-03T00:53:45-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-02T08:53:45-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0416871368.2021

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow continues this morning with a total of 15 cm expected by the time it ends. Hazards: 15 cm total of snow Heavy snowfall rates up to 4 cm per hour at times Timing: Snow continues through late this morning. The heaviest snow of the event is expected during this time. Impacts: Poor visibility in heavy snowfall Poor road conditions due to quickly accumulating snow Discussion: Regional weather RADAR shows snow continuing in eastern Ontario. Periods of heavy snow are expected during the next several hours before the snow eases and clears late this morning. Total snowfall amounts near 15 cm are expected. Ottawa Airport has reported 4 cm of snow as of 4 a.m. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-02T18:59:47-00:00

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this morning. This Winter Weather Travel Advisory has been upgraded from a Special Weather Statement that was previously in effect. Moderate to heavy snow is expected early this morning as a low pressure system moves off to the east. A snowfall accumulation of 5 to 10 cm is possible early this morning. This snowfall may result in difficult winter driving conditions as roads can become snow covered and icy. Conditions are expected to improve late this morning as snow is expected to end near mid morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
